programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: Two teams in the thick of the East playoff race do battle as the Red Wings host the Capitals. The teams have split their two prior 2023-24 meetings, although Washington's March 26 win required overtime. Alex DeBrincat (DET) scored in both contests.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Avalanche try to complete a rare season-series sweep of the Wild. Colorado won the first five meetings with Minnesota in 2000-01. Nathan MacKinnon, competing for the Hart and Art Ross, has six points in three games versus Minnesota this season.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: "NBA Countdown" serves as the primer for game telecasts on the ESPN family of networks. It's highlighted by a lively roundtable discussion and debate of the top storylines around the league. Seats at the table are reserved for folks in ESPN's stable of NBA hosts and analysts, with the latter group imparting wisdom based on their many years of playing experience.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Luka Doncic and the red-hot Mavericks pay a visit to the Heat for a postseason tune-up. Dallas has won three of the last four meetings after taking down Miami 114-108 on March 7. Doncic registered a 35-point triple-double in the victory.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Nuggets host the Timberwolves in a game that will go a long way in deciding the Western Conference's top seed. Denver earned the No. 1 seed in 2023. Minnesota leads the season series 2-1, holding Denver under 100 points in each of its wins.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: Welcome to The Masters
programme.desc: The Masters is the most coveted tournament for professional golfers. The competition is held every year at the Augusta National Golf Club, and the winner is awarded the traditional green jacket.

programme.title: 2024 Masters Tournament
programme.desc: Jon Rahm begins his title defense in the first round of the 2024 Masters Tournament. Rahm became the fourth Spaniard to don the Green Jacket in 2023. The 2021 U.S. Open champion and world No. 3 made waves in December 2023 by joining LIV Golf.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Hub Weekend Edition

programme.desc: From Texas Motor Speedway in Fort Worth, Texas.

programme.title: NASCAR RaceDay - NCTS
programme.desc: Behind the scenes and up-to-the minute reports from the garage prior to the start of each NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series race.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: The NASCAR Cup Series stays in Virginia for the Cook Out 400 from Martinsville Speedway. Denny Hamlin picked up his 53rd career Cup Series victory at the end of March in Richmond. Five of those wins came at Martinsville, but none since 2015.

programme.title: Concacaf Champions Cup
programme.desc: Quarterfinal, 2nd Leg.

programme.title: NASCAR Xfinity Racing Series
programme.desc: The NASCAR Xfinity Series stays in Virginia for the Dude Wipes 250 from Martinsville Speedway. Last week, Chandler Smith defended his ToyotaCare 250 crown and won for the second time in three weeks with his checkered flag at Richmond Raceway.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: The NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series returns to action with the Long John Silver's 200 at Martinsville Raceway. Corey Heim's victory March 23 at Circuit of the Americas gave the 21-year-old Georgian five top-six finishes in five races this season.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Hub Presents
programme.desc: Dive into the untold stories of racing legends, their groundbreaking innovations, and the pivotal moments that shaped the high-octane world of NASCAR, paying homage to the trailblazers who defined the need for speed.

programme.title: PokerStars Caribbean Adventure

programme.title: PokerStars Caribbean Adventure
programme.desc: Just 16 players remain from almost a thousand entries at the PCA Main Event. Accomplished American Pro, Jonathan Little hopes to use his experience to make the Final Table and take a shot at the $1.5m first prize.

programme.title: Inside the NBA
programme.desc: This Emmy Award-winning studio show, which airs following each NBA telecast on TNT, is hosted by Ernie Johnson, with analysis from Hall of Famer Charles Barkley and NBA champions Kenny Smith and Shaquille O'Neal. It's a mix of highlights, interviews and hijinks, notably the verbal sparring sessions between the outspoken Barkley and his straight man, Smith. The show also welcomes various guest analysts throughout the season.
